io.netty.handler.codec.http

Class HttpServerCodec

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelStateHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.channel.ChannelDuplexHandler
          • io.netty.channel.CombinedChannelDuplexHandler
            • io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpServerCodec
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, ChannelInboundByteHandler, ChannelOperationHandler, ChannelOutboundMessageHandler<HttpObject>, ChannelStateHandler

    public final class HttpServerCodec
extends CombinedChannelDuplexHandler
implements ChannelInboundByteHandler, ChannelOutboundMessageHandler<HttpObject>
    A combination of HttpRequestDecoder and HttpResponseEncoder which enables easier server side HTTP implementation.
    See Also:
    HttpClientCodec

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler

        ChannelHandler.Sharable

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpServerCodec()
      Creates a new instance with the default decoder options (maxInitialLineLength (4096}, maxHeaderSize (8192), and maxChunkSize (8192)).

      Creates a new instance with the specified decoder options.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void discardInboundReadBytes(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Discards the read bytes of the inbound buffer and optionally trims its unused portion to reduce memory consumption.
      void freeInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Invoked when this handler is not going to receive any inbound message anymore and thus it's safe to deallocate its inbound buffer.
      void freeOutboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Invoked when this handler is not allowed to send any outbound message anymore and thus it's safe to deallocate its outbound buffer.
      ByteBuf newInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Return the Buf which will be used for inbound data for the given ChannelHandlerContext.
      MessageBuf<HttpObject> newOutboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
      Return the Buf which will be used for outbound data for the given ChannelHandlerContext.

      • discardInboundReadBytes

        public void discardInboundReadBytes(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                             throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: ChannelInboundByteHandler
        Discards the read bytes of the inbound buffer and optionally trims its unused portion to reduce memory consumption. The most common implementation of this method will look like the following: 
             ctx.inboundByteBuffer().discardSomeReadBytes();
        Specified by:
        discardInboundReadBytes in interface ChannelInboundByteHandler
        Throws:
        Exception

      • freeInboundBuffer

        public void freeInboundBuffer(ChannelHandlerContext ctx)
                       throws Exception
        Invoked when this handler is not going to receive any inbound message anymore and thus it's safe to deallocate its inbound buffer.
        Throws:
        Exception
